biolockj.module

Class JavaModuleImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.ScriptModuleImpl
        • biolockj.module.JavaModuleImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BioModule, JavaModule, ScriptModule
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AddMetadataToOtuTables, Demultiplexer, JsonReport, Multiplexer, Normalizer, ParserModuleImpl, Rarefier, RegisterNumReads, SeqFileValidator, TrimPrimers

    public abstract class JavaModuleImpl
extends ScriptModuleImpl
implements JavaModule
    Superclass for Java BioModules that will be called in separate instances of the application.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      List<List<String>> buildScript(List<File> files)
      Java script only require 2 lines, one to run the blj_config to update our $PATH and gain access to environment variables, and then the direct call to the BioLockJ.jar.
      void executeTask()
      JavaModules run pure Java code.
      If in Docker mode and not in Direct mode, execute BioModule.executeTask() to build the bash script.
      If not in Docker mode AND on the cluster AND Config."cluster.runJavaAsScriptModule"="Y" execute BioModule.executeTask() to build the bash script
      Otherwise, execute runModule() to run the Java code to execute module functionality.
      protected String getSource()
      Get the program source (either the jar path or main class biolockj.BioLockJ);
      protected void markStatus(String status)
      This method sets the module status by saving the indicator file to the module root dir.
      void moduleComplete()
      This method will create the success flag file so the next module can run.
      void moduleFailed()
      This method will create the fail flag file so the pipeline can move on..
      abstract void runModule()
      This method executes the modules primary Java routine.

      • buildScript

        public List<List<String>> buildScript(List<File> files)
                               throws Exception
        Java script only require 2 lines, one to run the blj_config to update our $PATH and gain access to environment variables, and then the direct call to the BioLockJ.jar.
        Specified by:
        buildScript in interface ScriptModule
        Specified by:
        buildScript in class ScriptModuleImpl
        Parameters:
        files - Files in the input directory that contain only forward reads
        Returns:
        Nested list of bash scripts lines
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to generate script lines

      • executeTask

        public void executeTask()
                 throws Exception
        JavaModules run pure Java code.
        If in Docker mode and not in Direct mode, execute BioModule.executeTask() to build the bash script.
        If not in Docker mode AND on the cluster AND Config."cluster.runJavaAsScriptModule"="Y" execute BioModule.executeTask() to build the bash script
        Otherwise, execute runModule() to run the Java code to execute module functionality.
        Specified by:
        executeTask in interface BioModule
        Overrides:
        executeTask in class ScriptModuleImpl
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if the module is unable to complete is task
